intro: Isopyrum franchetii, commonly known as the mountain sweetroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features a robust rhizome system and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in early summer. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a distinctive hairy texture. Isopyrum franchetii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and rocky slopes.
